page.title: 04Newcastle Eldon Square
page.content: It was{built in 1976}on the Eldon Square site named after one of Newcastle's famous sons, Lord Eldon. It is the{largest{shopping centre in {Western Europe.} It has every kind of shop ranging from coffee bars to department stores and an indoor market (Green Market). Its indoor streets are designed with space for sitting around fountains, design set pieces and open cafes and there are large street maps. It closes overnight. It has a bus station, a Metro interchange and two car parks. About{12m shoppers}use it every year from a catchment including the {Borders, Carlisle and the Scandinavian {ferry links.} Especially at Christmas. Future question marks are the{very {high rates,}higher than in New Bond Street and competition from the car accessible Dunston, Gateshead scheme.
